title: Romantic animated Valentine proposal single-page site (YES/NO playful flow + celebration scene)

requirements.text: Create a single-page, fully responsive Valentine proposal experience with a soft dreamy romantic aesthetic: pastel pink/red palette, glow effects, sparkles, smooth animations, and a cute modern UI. Use a typography pairing of a romantic cursive headline font plus a clean modern body font, applied consistently across the site.

quotes: Create a romantic animated Valentine proposal website with a soft, dreamy, loveable aesthetic.
Lovely typography (romantic cursive + clean modern font)

acceptanceCriteria: Layout looks polished on common mobile widths (e.g., 360‚Äì430px) and desktop widths (>=1024px) with no overflow/overlap issues.
All screens share a consistent palette, typography, spacing, and animation style (dreamy/romantic).
Animations are smooth and do not cause obvious jank on typical devices (avoid excessive reflows; prefer transform/opacity animations).

requirements.text: Implement an animated floating-hearts background that runs continuously on both the Proposal scene and the Celebration scene. Add additional subtle sparkles/glow accents to support a magical, love-focused atmosphere.
acceptanceCriteria: Hearts float continuously behind the main content on both scenes.
Foreground content remains readable and accessible (sufficient contrast; background elements do not obscure text/buttons).
Sparkle/glow accents are visible but subtle (not distracting or reducing performance noticeably).

requirements.text:
Build the Proposal scene with centered content and exact user-facing text:
- Headline: "Will you be my Valentine? ‚ù§Ô∏è"
- Subtext: "I choose you. Today, tomorrow, always."
Include two buttons: "YES üíñ" (primary, glowing/animated/attractive) and "NO üíî" (secondary, playful).
acceptanceCriteria: The Proposal scene renders the headline and subtext exactly as specified.
YES button is visually primary and has an animated/glow treatment.
NO button is visually secondary and clearly clickable (until it evades).
Both buttons are usable via touch on mobile (adequate size and spacing).

requirements.text:
Implement playful prevention logic so the user cannot complete the experience without clicking the YES button:
- Clicking "NO üíî" must trigger evasive behavior (e.g., move away, resize, disappear briefly, or relocate randomly) and/or show teasing romantic messages.
- Provide a rotating set of playful messages including:
  - "Wrong choice üòú"
  - "Try again, my love ‚ù§Ô∏è"
  - "Your heart knows the answer üíï"
  - "You can‚Äôt escape destiny üòå"

quotes: The user should never be able to finish without clicking YES

When user clicks NO: Button should move away, resize, disappear, or relocate randomly OR show playful romantic messages like: ‚ÄúWrong choice üòú‚Äù ‚ÄúTry again, my love ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äù ‚ÄúYour heart knows the answer üíï‚Äù ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt escape destiny üòå‚Äù

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking NO never navigates to the Celebration scene.
NO click triggers an evasive state change (position/scale/visibility) in a way that is clearly noticeable.
At least the four specified messages are used as possible outputs (shown in the UI).
The experience remains functional on both mouse and touch input (NO evasive behavior works on mobile).

requirements.text: Add global playful interactions on the Proposal scene: clicking anywhere that is not the YES button should trigger cute/teasing romantic messages and a short burst of additional floating hearts (or similar heart particle burst). Ensure these interactions do not interfere with the ability to click YES.

quotes: Clicking anywhere else (except YES) should trigger: Cute messages Floating hearts animation Sweet teasing text Romantic encouragements

acceptanceCriteria: Clicks/taps outside the YES button trigger a visible reaction (message + heart burst).
Repeated clicks cycle through multiple messages (not always the same line).
YES remains clickable and is not blocked by overlays or pointer-capturing effects.

requirements.text: Implement the YES flow: clicking "YES üíñ" triggers confetti hearts and a smooth scene transition (fade and/or romantic motion transition) from the Proposal scene into the Celebration scene.

quotes: YES Button Action: Smooth transition animation Screen fades into a second romantic scene

acceptanceCriteria: YES click triggers a celebratory effect (heart confetti) immediately.
A smooth transition occurs (fade/slide/zoom) into the Celebration scene without abrupt content jumps.
After transition, Proposal content is no longer visible/interactable.

requirements.text:
Build the Celebration scene with the same animated heart background and the following centered content:
- Text above: "She said YES üíç‚ù§Ô∏è"
- A central circular photo with a glowing border and a subtle continuous zoom-in (or gentle breathing) animation
- Text below: "My forever Valentine üíï"

quotes: Our photo in the center (circular frame with glowing border)

acceptanceCriteria: The Celebration scene displays the two text lines exactly as specified.
A circular image is shown with a visible glowing border.
The photo has a subtle continuous animation that feels romantic (no harsh scaling).
Background hearts continue animating on the Celebration scene.

requirements.text: Add cursor/touch-following heart particle effects and occasional floating love emojis as ambient effects. Effects must work on both desktop (mouse) and mobile (touch) and degrade gracefully when reduced motion is preferred.
acceptanceCriteria: On desktop, moving the cursor produces a visible trailing heart particle effect.
On mobile, touch/move gestures produce a similar effect where supported.
If the user has prefers-reduced-motion enabled, effects are reduced or disabled to avoid overwhelming motion.

requirements.text: Add optional soft romantic background music support: include an audio file in static assets and provide unobtrusive in-UI controls (play/pause and mute). Default behavior should be respectful: do not auto-play if the browser blocks it; allow the user to start music with a tap/click.
acceptanceCriteria: A visible but unobtrusive music control exists on both scenes (or globally).
Music can be started/stopped by the user and respects browser autoplay policies (no broken UX if autoplay is blocked).
Music state (playing/muted) persists across the scene transition in the same session.

requirements.text: Add lightweight preloading and performance optimizations for smooth first interaction: preload key assets (fonts, generated images, optional audio) and ensure animations are efficient. Keep code structure clean and modular (separate components for background/effects/scenes).
acceptanceCriteria: Key assets are preloaded or loaded in a way that avoids flashes/pop-in during the first scene.
Background/effects/scenes are implemented as reusable components with clear separation of concerns.
No console errors in the browser during normal use.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose shadcn components instead).
Do not edit immutable hook/bootstrapping files: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor if used; do not introduce additional backend services.
nonGoals: User authentication (Internet Identity) or user accounts.
Server-side storage of uploaded photos or music.
Multi-page routing; the experience should remain a single-page flow with scene transitions.
External analytics, ads, social integrations, or third-party APIs.

required: Soft pastel floating hearts background texture (valentine-hearts-bg.dim_1920x1080.png)
